intro: Batrachium villosum, commonly known as the hairy frogfruit, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Batrachium villosum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
